com.lehman.ic9.net

Class httpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle

        • org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
          • com.lehman.ic9.net.httpServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Container, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle

    public class httpServer
extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
    Class httpServer implements customizations on the Jetty HTTP server for use in the ic9engine.
    Author:
    Austin Lehman

    • Constructor Detail

      • httpServer

        public httpServer(ic9engine Eng,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> JsServerInstance,
                  java.lang.String Host,
                  int Port)
        Default constructor takes the current engine, the JavaScript server instance, the host, and the port to bind to and initialized the HTTP server object.
        Parameters:
        Eng - is an ic9engine object.
        JsServerInstance - is a JS instance of the server.
        Host - is a String with the host name of the server.
        Port - is an int with the port number to bind to.

    • Method Detail

      • setThreads

        public void setThreads(int MaxThreads,
                       int MinThreads)
                throws ic9exception
        Sets the number of min and max threads for the server. The default values are 0 for both minimum and maximum meaning that the number of threads is unbound. To set the min and max to something other than unbound you need to call this method before starting the server. Unless maximum threads is 0, the maximum number of threads must be greater than the minimum number of threads.
        Parameters:
        MaxThreads - is an int with the maximum number of threads to use.
        MinThreads - is an int with the minimum number of threads to use.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts the server. This call blocks until the server is shutdown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • handle

        public void handle(java.lang.String target,
                   org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request baseRequest,

            throws java.io.IOException,

        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • setSsl

        public void setSsl(java.lang.String JavaKeyStoreFile,
                   java.lang.String KeyStorePassword)
        Sets the SSL key store information and sets the use SSL flag for the server. This method must be called before calling startServer() method. Generate Java Key Store Example: keytool -genkey -keyalg RSA -alias selfsigned -keystore testkeystore.jks -storepass password -validity 360 -keysize 2048
        Parameters:
        JavaKeyStoreFile - is a Java key store file name to use.
        KeyStorePassword - is the Java key store password.

      • setWs

        public void setWs()
        Sets the flag to use websockets.

      • decodeBasicAuth

        public static java.lang.String decodeBasicAuth(java.lang.String Encoded)
        Static function that decodes the provided encoded basic authentication String.
        Parameters:
        Encoded - is a Base64 encoded String provided by the browser.
        Returns:
        Unencoded string with the contents.
